trustfund:
TF052674-PHRD-GAMBIA: COMMUNITY BASED
            RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF055124-PHRD-GAMBIA: COMMUNITY
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Community-Driven
            Development Project for Gambia were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: investment in capacity building at all
            levels is essential for localizing development and promoting
            local governance. Commitment to reforms and strong political
            will to decentralization is fundamental to projects that
            seek to support its implementation. It is not enough to just
            transfer management of resources to beneficiaries, strong
            oversight is needed to guard against elite capture,
            political hijacking or deviation from the bottom up
            approach. The project coverage was ambitious, even though
            this was meant to extend the coverage of the benefit to many
            communities as possible, may result in lower per capita
            benefit. Also, there are many unmet needs in the approved
            Strategic Development Plan (SDP) which could have led to
            greater impact in case the project will have covered less
            villages and wards. The way it is, impacts were spread
            rather thinly.
